title: @Jaredan. Are Bilgewater's guns and cannons hextech, enchanted, alchemical gunpowder or not magic?
body: Graves' gun Destiny is hextech, but how about the others, and in Bilgewater in general? In the lore, are their guns able to shoot crazy volumes of bullets like MF's Bullet Time in the game? How common are magical weapons in Bilgewater/Valoran anyway?

replies.body:
Magical weapons are not common at all. You wouldn't see everyone carrying a hextech pistol on their hip. In fact, walking around with such a weapon for everyone to see would quickly garner the sort of attention you don't want. Unless you're Graves, who is perfectly happy with that sort of attention. Destiny is a unique gun that very few smiths in the world would have any hope in replicating. In the story world, you wouldn't necessarily see the exact type of effects as you see in-game. 

I hope that helps.

Sooo... guns're hextech. Gotcha.

Edit: Err, I like the whole story around it too, don't misunderstand me.
I see you can write in English.  Can you read it?  Guns are normal.  Hextech is not.

Ok. Gotcha, hextech pistols are rare.

Do ordinary guns exist?

Well let's look at it, who in League has guns that aren't in anyway hextech looking?

{{champion:41}} and {{champion:21}}. Their guns use bullets and gunpowder.

{{champion:18}} similarly uses a cannon, and it's just a full blown cannon. No trace of hextech in sight.

I'd argue that {{champion:222}} has only one hextech weapon, that being Zapper, but I'm not 100% sure if Pow-Pow and Fishbones are hextech or not.

League's cast is a bunch of the more remarkable folks who live in Runeterra. The fact the many have hextechnology at their disposal isn't all that surprising.
Jinx likely got her guns from Piltover and/or Zaun, so it wouldn't be surprising for them to have a fair bit of hextech in 'em.

Sooo.... you can't read. Gotcha.

>Magical weapons are not common at all

>You wouldn't see everyone carrying a hextech pistol

> Destiny is a unique gun

Why do you say "story world" as if the story for League of Legends doesn't include the game it's a story for?

Doesn't that sound kind of stupid and contrary?

This might be overly agressive leaving it at just that, so let me ask some relevant on-topic questions aswell.

What kind of effects would we see from a hextech weapon outside of the ones used by the Champions in the League of Legends? Just straight up d&d style hits easier and deals more damage, or more esoteric things like bullet bending, or lighting a sword on fire, or firing lighting from your spear? or other fantastical effects?
Thanks a lot for replying! I love all the stuff you're doing, but little tidbits like these are also really fun to get here and there!

Speaking of guns, what type of airships do Runeterra have? Solely zeppelin are are there like steampunkesque flying ships too? I'd assume they'd be Piltover/Zaun hextech creations, maybe even magically powered. Just wondering what kind of air power Runeterra is at.
